description: Nikola Petrak quietly decides to support the 'vanished,' choosing to pass them evidence of BCI abuses and system protocols rather than authorize the Directorate's blackout plan.
The Directorate detects unusual information leaks and security alerts escalate. The Council scrambles to locate the breach as reports of BCI irregularities surface.
Groups of 'vanished' citizens appear at neighborhood forums, openly sharing evidence of erased identities and life beyond BCI control. Early non-score zones are announced, drawing citywide attention.

Spurred by the testimonies of the 'vanished,' residents in several districts propose and vote to establish 'non-score zones,' refusing ongoing BCI surveillance. Confusion and hope ripple through the city.

Divisions within the Council deepen as the Directorate demands crackdowns while Innovators argue for negotiation. Public marches and gatherings amplify pressure for a citywide choice on algorithmic governance.
